macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: $3 Billion Bitcoin and Ethereum Options Expiry Tests Market Rally
items.summary: Nearly $3 billion in Bitcoin ($2.4B) and Ethereum ($437M) options expire on January 16, with Bitcoin's put-to-call ratio at 1.26 indicating defensive positioning despite its breakout above $95,000.

items.title: Bitcoin Rally Triggers $700M in Short Liquidations
items.summary: Bitcoin surged past $97,000 on Wednesday, forcing $700 million in short liquidations and resetting trader expectations, amid optimism for Fed rate cuts and potential CLARITY Act passage.

items.title: US Senate Delays CLARITY Act Markup Amid Controversies
items.summary: The Senate Banking Committee postponed discussion of the Digital Asset Market Clarity Act due to debates over stablecoin yields, DeFi liability, and SEC/CFTC oversight; Coinbase CEO withdraws support and ex-SEC accountant warns of risks.

items.title: Tether Freezes $182M in USDT on Law Enforcement Request
items.summary: Tether froze approximately $182 million in USDT across five Tron addresses at law enforcement's request, marking one of its largest single-day actions.

items.title: Indonesia Ranks as Top 10 Global Crypto Market
items.summary: Indonesia has become one of the world's top 10 crypto markets due to retail adoption, on-chain activity, and 2025 regulatory shift placing crypto under OJK financial supervision as digital instruments.

items.title: World Liberty Financial Launches USD1 Stablecoin Lending Platform
items.summary: World Liberty Financial launched a lending platform on Dolomite for its USD1 stablecoin, allowing users to lend/borrow with crypto collateral, boosting WLF and DOLO tokens.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Machine Learning Accelerates Discovery of Novel CDK9 Inhibitors for Cancer Treatment
items.summary: Researchers used AI-driven virtual screening to identify 14 potential CDK9 inhibitors, narrowing to one promising candidate with cytotoxic effects in cancer cell lines. The approach reduced time and costs in drug discovery, as published in Biomolecules.

items.title: World Economic Forum Adds 23 New Lighthouses and Launches AI-Powered Lumina Platform
items.summary: The Global Lighthouse Network recognized 23 new sites excelling in AI-integrated industrial transformation, focusing on productivity, sustainability, and resilience. Lumina, a new AI platform, analyzes data showing 94% of successful transformations combine AI with IoT and other tech.

items.title: OpenAI Invests in Merge Labs' Non-Invasive Brain-Computer Interface
items.summary: OpenAI co-funded seed round for Merge Labs, co-founded by Sam Altman, developing biology-AI-device BCIs for seamless human-AI interaction without implants. The investment highlights BCIs as a key frontier for natural technology control.

items.title: Kaggle Launches Community Benchmarks for Custom AI Model Evaluations
items.summary: Google-owned Kaggle introduced Community Benchmarks, enabling users to create and share custom metrics for AI models, enhancing collaboration and real-world performance assessment in software development.

items.title: AI Algorithm Accurately Distinguishes Alpha Thalassemia Subtypes from Blood Tests
items.summary: A new AI model effectively differentiates alpha thalassemia subtypes using routine blood data, advancing rapid diagnostics in hematology.

items.title: Enchanted Rock Appoints VP to Drive AI-Powered Data Center Growth
items.summary: Enchanted Rock hired Regis Malloy as SVP of Data Centers to support hyperscale and AI-driven expansion, leveraging machine learning for infrastructure.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Neurable and HyperX Brain-Tracking Gaming Headset Wins Top Honors at CES 2026
items.summary: Neurable and HyperX's collaborative gaming headset with noninvasive brain-computer interface technology received recognition in Tom's Guide's 'Best of CES 2026' and TechRadar's 'Best Headset' for optimizing player focus and performance.

items.title: Nintendo Plans to Produce Up to 25 Million Switch 2 Units by March 2026
items.summary: Nintendo has reportedly instructed suppliers to manufacture up to 25 million units of the Switch 2 to be ready for market by March 2026.

items.title: Meta Lays Off Staff at Batman: Arkham Shadow Developer Camouflaj
items.summary: Meta has laid off employees at Camouflaj, the studio behind Batman: Arkham Shadow, as part of broader workforce reductions.

items.title: Ubisoft Confirms Layoffs at Abu Dhabi Studio
items.summary: Ubisoft has confirmed layoffs at its Abu Dhabi studio amid ongoing industry challenges.

items.title: Microsoft, Sony, and Nintendo Issue Joint Update on Player Safety Commitment
items.summary: Microsoft, Sony, and Nintendo provided a joint update reaffirming their commitment to player safety initiatives.

items.title: ARC Raiders Passes 12.4 Million Units Sold Milestone
items.summary: Nexon's ARC Raiders from Embark Studios has sold over 12.4 million units with 960,000 concurrent players ten weeks post-launch on October 30, 2025.

items.title: Rockstar Games Launches Official Mod Marketplace
items.summary: Rockstar Games has introduced an official marketplace for mods, enabling creators to monetize their work.

items.title: Fired Rockstar Workers Denied Interim Pay and Visas in Tribunal Hearing
items.summary: Former Rockstar Games employees were denied requests for interim pay and work visas at a preliminary employment tribunal hearing.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: US Imposes 25% Tariff on Nvidia's H200 AI Chips to China
items.summary: The Trump administration formalized a 25% tariff on Nvidia's H200 semiconductors destined for China, while allowing sales to approved commercial customers vetted by the Department of Commerce. Nvidia had been considering ramping up production due to strong early orders from Chinese companies.

items.title: TSMC Predicts 25% Increase in Capital Expenditures
items.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company announced a 25% bump in capital expenditures for the year, reigniting investor interest in chip stocks and boosting semiconductor equipment manufacturers like Applied Materials and KLA.

items.title: Canon Maintains Top 10 U.S. Patent Ranking for 42 Years
items.summary: Canon ranked seventh in the U.S. patent rankings for 2025, continuing its 42-year streak of maintaining a position in the top 10 patent holders.

items.title: NTT Releases IOWN Technology Report on Quantum and Optical Computing
items.summary: NTT published its latest IOWN Technology Report focusing on optical-quantum computing trajectories, next-generation data centers, and space industry applications including stratospheric HAPS technology.

items.title: Major Cybersecurity Incidents: Nissan, ASML, and Japanese Manufacturers Targeted
items.summary: Nissan Motor Corporation suffered a ransomware attack by Everest Ransomware resulting in the theft of 900 gigabytes of sensitive data including blueprints and financial records. Additionally, ASML reported a significant data leak of approximately 154 databases, and Japanese manufacturer Sugawara Laboratories was compromised by Qilin Ransomware.
